page.title: 06GREAT BERWICK FARM
page.content: {GREAT BERWICK FARM One ot the farms visited _ Great Berwick farm _ has an acerage of 214 acres and the present farmer said that he had lived there for 40 years.Part of this land is taken up with 17 acres of barley,22 acres of winter wheat and 6 acres of fodder beet.The rest of the land is grazing for the 160 Fresian dairy cows,milked 3 times each day.As well as the dairy cows,the farmer owns a total of 240 heifers and calves. 2 cowmen 1 tractor driver and a father & son team work on the farm.The buildings looked modern & were probably fairly new. The farmer could think of no disadvantages to living here.He loves the remarkable views to the Welsh hills and the peace of the countryside.(CONT.page 7)
